title: Pan Tilt Tracker (Visual Servoing)
description: Developed a motorized smartphone holder paired with an Android video recording app, enabling pan-and-tilt tracking and gesture controls for recording. Originally created for filming my dance practice sessions, this project will be expanded with an upcoming feature currently in development, aimed at facilitating the creation and practice of dance choreographies (Coming Soon!).
tasks: Implemented TensorFlow-based Pose Estimation (PoseNet) in the Android app
Developed PID Controller within the Android app
Enabled Bluetooth communication between the app and the holder
Designed and programmed the embedded board (Arduino for V1, ESP32 for V2)
Designed and developed the entire hardware, including mechanical, electrical, and CAD models
3D-printed parts

title: Fun And Drive (Car Game Simulator)
description: Developed an open-world vehicle simulator game using Unity, featuring custom drivetrain and wheel physics simulations. While the primary focus is on cars, the game is designed to eventually support other vehicles, including bikes, airplanes, helicopters, and boats.
tasks: Implemented custom drivetrain and wheel physics.
Integrated clutch simulation within the drivetrain.
Implemented classic AI algorithms for virtual opponents using geometry-based techniques.
Developed a race manager with a participant ranking system (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.).
Developed a dynamic player-following camera system.
Designed and built a GUI dashboard system.

title: Multicam (School Project)
description: Collaborated in a team to develop a real-time multi-camera system for tracking, monitoring, and localizing individuals in potential danger during emergencies, enhancing firefighter operations through a tablet interface.
tasks: Led the team, enhancing leadership, communication, and teamwork skills.
Developed central server software for camera video reception, image processing, and human activity classification.
Implemented network management for seamless multi-camera operation.
Programmed C++ firmware for ESP32-Cam modules.
Contributed to Android tablet app development for video feedback and victim information display.
